name: Utils
desc:
import { Utils } from 'mythix-ui-core@1.0';

Misc utility functions and global constants are found within this namespace.
Generate a partially random unique ID. The id generated will be a Date.now() value with an incrementing BigInt postfixed to it.
name: generateID

desc:
Create an unresolved specialized Promise instance, with the intent that it will be resolved later.

The Promise instance is specialized because the following properties are injected into it:

  1. resolve(resultValue) - When called, resolves the promise with the first provided argument
  2. reject(errorValue) - When called, rejects the promise with the first provided argument
  3. status() - When called, will return the fulfillment status of the promise, as a string, one of: "pending", "fulfilled", or "rejected"
  4. id<string> - A randomly generated ID for this promise
return: Promise An unresolved Promise that can be resolved or rejected by calling promise.resolve(result) or promise.reject(error) respectively.
name: createResolvable

desc:
Runtime type reflection helper. This is intended to be a more robust replacement for the typeof operator.

This method always returns a name (as a string type) of the underlying datatype. The "datatype" is a little loose for primitive types. For example, a primitive typeof x === 'number' type is returned as its corresponding Object (class) type 'Number'. For boolean it will instead return 'Boolean', and for 'string', it will instead return 'String'. This is true of all underlying primitive types.

For internal datatypes, it will return the real class name prefixed by two colons. For example, typeOf(new Map()) will return '::Map'.

Non-internal types will not be prefixed, allowing custom types with the same name as internal types to also be detected. For example, class Test {}; typeOf(new Test()) will result in the non-prefixed result 'Test'.

For raw function types, typeOf will check if they are a constructor or not. If a constructor is detected, then the format '[Class ${name}]' will be returned as the type. For internal types the name will be prefixed, i.e. [Class ::${internalName}], and for non-internal types will instead be non-prefixed, i.e. [Class ${name}] . For example, typeOf(Map) will return '[Class ::Map]', whereas typeOf(Test) will result in '[Class Test]'.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: The value whose type you wish to discover.

return: string The name of the provided type, or an empty string '' if the provided value has no type.
notes: This method will look for a Symbol.toStringTag key on the value provided‚Ä¶ and if found, will use it to assist with finding the correct type name.
If the value provided is type-less, i.e. undefined, null, or NaN, then an empty type '' will be returned.
Use the typeof operator if you want to detect if a type is primitive or not.
name: typeOf

desc:
Runtime type reflection helper. This is intended to be a more robust replacement for the instanceof operator.

This method will return true if the provided value is any of the provided types.

The provided types can each either be a real raw type (i.e. String class), or the name of a type, as a string, i.e. '::String'.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: The value whose type you wish to compare.

arguments.name: ...types
arguments.desc: All types you wish to check against. String values compare types by name, function values compare types by instanceof.

return:
boolean

  1. Return true if value matches any of the provided types.
  2. Otherwise, false is returned.
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.typeOf.
name: isType

desc: Verify that the provided value is a number type (or Number instance), and that it is not NaN, Infinity, or -Infinity.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: Value to check

return:
boolean

  1. Return true if value is a number (or Number instance) and is also not NaN, Infinity, or -Infinity. i.e. (isNumber(value) && isFinite(value)).
  2. Otherwise, false is returned.
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.typeOf.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.isType.
name: isValidNumber

desc:
Verify that the provided value is a "plain"/"vanilla" Object instance.

This method is intended to help the caller detect if an object is a "raw plain object", inheriting from Object.prototype (or a null prototype).

  1. isPlainObject({}) will return true.
  2. isPlainObject(new Object()) will return true.
  3. isPlainObject(Object.create(null)) will return true.
  4. isPlainObject(new CustomClass()) will return false.
  5. All other invocations should return false.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: Value to check

return:
boolean

  1. Return true if value is a "raw"/"plain" Object instance.
  2. Otherwise, false is returned.
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.typeOf.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.isType.
name: isPlainObject

desc: Detect if the provided value is a javascript primitive type.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: Value to check

return:
boolean

  1. Return true if value is a "raw"/"plain" Object instance.
  2. Otherwise, false is returned.
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.typeOf.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.isType.
name: isPrimitive
SHA256
desc: SHA256 hashing function

arguments.name: input
arguments.desc: Input string

return: string The SHA256 hash of the provided input.
notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is a custom baked SHA256 hashing function, minimized for size. It may be incomplete, and it is strongly recommended that you DO NOT use this for anything related to security.
‚ö†Ô∏è Read all the notes, and use this method with caution.

‚ÑπÔ∏è This method has been modified slightly from the original to not bail when unicode characters are detected. There is a decent chance that--given certain input--this method will return an invalid SHA256 hash."
‚ÑπÔ∏è Mythix UI uses this method simply to generate consistent IDs.
‚ù§Ô∏è Many thanks to the author Geraint Luff for this method!

name: Elements
desc:
import { Elements } from 'mythix-ui-core@1.0';

Utility and element building functions for the DOM.

Almost like Object.assign, merge all component children into a single node (the target).

This is "template intelligent", meaning for <template> elements specifically, it will execute children = template.content.cloneNode(true).childNodes to clone all the child nodes, and not modify the original template. It is also template intelligent by the fact that if the target is a template, it will add the children to content properly.

arguments.name: target
arguments.desc: The target Node to merge all children into. If this Node is a <template> Node, then it will place all the merged children into template.content.

notes: Any template Node will be cloned, and so the original will not be modified. All other nodes are NOT cloned before the merge, and so will be stripped of their children.
Make certain you deep clone any element first (except templates) if you don't want the provided elements to be modified.
return: Node The provided target, with all children merged (added) into it.
name: mergeChildren
Components
desc:
import { Components } from 'mythix-ui-core@1.0';

Component and framework classes and functionality are found here.

This the base class of all Mythix UI components. It inherits from HTMLElement, and so will end up being a Web Component.

It is strongly recommended that you fully read up and understand Web Components if you don't already fully understand them. The core of Mythix UI is the Web Component standard, so you might end up a little confused if you don't already understand the foundation.
name: MythixUIComponent

desc: Called when the component is added to the DOM.

arguments.name: mutationRecord
arguments.desc: The MutationRecord instance that that caused this method to be called.

name: onMutationAdded

desc: Called when the component is removed from the DOM.

arguments.name: mutationRecord
arguments.desc: The MutationRecord instance that that caused this method to be called.

name: onMutationRemoved

desc: Called when an element is added as a child.

arguments.name: node
arguments.desc: The child element being added.

arguments.name: mutationRecord
arguments.desc: The MutationRecord instance that that caused this method to be called.

name: onMutationChildAdded

desc: Called when a child element is removed.

arguments.name: node
arguments.desc: The child element being removed.

arguments.name: mutationRecord
arguments.desc: The MutationRecord instance that that caused this method to be called.

name: onMutationChildRemoved

desc:
A convenience method for getting and setting attributes. If only one argument is provided to this method, then it will act as a getter, getting the attribute specified by name.

If however two or more arguments are provided, then this is an attribute setter.

If the provided value is undefined, null, or false, then the attribute will be removed.

If the provided value is true, then the attribute's value will be set to an empty string ''.

Any other value is converted to a string and set as the attribute's value.

arguments.name: name
arguments.desc: The name of the attribute to operate on.

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: If undefined, null, or false, remove the named attribute. If true, set the named attribute's value to an empty string ''. For any other value, first convert it into a string, and then set the named attribute's value to the resulting string.

return:
1. string If a single argument is provided, then return the value of the specified named attribute.
  2. this If more than one argument is provided, then set the specified attribute to the specified value, and return this (to allow for chaining).
name: attr

desc:
Inject a new style sheet via a <style> element dynamically at run-time.

This method allows the caller to inject dynamic styles at run-time. It will only inject the styles once, no matter how many times the method is called--as long as the style content itself doesn't change.

The content is hashed via SHA256, and the hash is used as the style sheet id. This allows you to call the method inside a component's MythixUIComponent.mounted method, without needing to worry about duplicating the styles over and over again.

arguments.name: content
arguments.desc: The CSS stylesheet content to inject into a <style> element. This content is used to generate an id for the <style> element, so that it only gets added to the document once.

arguments.name: media
arguments.desc: What to set the media attribute of the created <style> element to. Defaults to 'screen'.

notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è It is often better to simply add a <style> element to your component's HTML template. However, sometimes truly dynamic styles are needed, where the content won't be known until runtime. This is the proper use case for this method.

‚ö†Ô∏è Please educated yourself (unlike people who love React) and do not overuse dynamic or inline styles. While the result of this method is certainly a step above inline styles, this method has great potential to cause harm and spread your own ignorance to others. Use with CARE!
return: Element The <style> element for the specified style.
examples:
import { MythixUIComponent } from 'mythix-ui-core@1.0';

class MyComponent extends MythixUIComponent {
  static tagName = 'my-component';

  // ...

  mounted() {
    let { sidebarWidth } = this.loadUserPreferences();
    this.injectStyleSheet(`nav.sidebar { width: ${sidebarWidth}px; }`, 'screen');
  }
}

MyComponent.register();
name: injectStyleSheet

desc: Get the parent Node of this element.
notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Unlike Node.parentNode, this will also search across Shadow DOM boundaries.
‚ö†Ô∏è Searching across Shadow DOM boundaries only works for Mythix UI components!

‚ÑπÔ∏è Searching across Shadow DOM boundaries is accomplished via leveraging MythixUIComponent.metadata for this component. When a null parent is encountered, getParentNode will look for metadata key Utils.MYTHIX_SHADOW_PARENT (a symbol) on this. If found, the result is considered the parent Node of this component.
üëÅÔ∏è This is just a wrapper for Utils.getParentNode.
return: Node The parent node, if there is any, or null otherwise.
name: getParentNode

desc:
This is a replacement for Element.attachShadow with one notable difference: It runs Mythix UI framework specific code after a shadow is attached.

Currently, the method completes the following actions:

  1. Call super.attachShadow(options) to actually attach a Shadow DOM
  2. Assign metadata to the resulting shadow, using the key Utils.MYTHIX_SHADOW_PARENT, and value of this. arrow_outward This allows getParentNode to later find the parent of the shadow.
  3. return shadow

arguments.name: options
arguments.desc: options for Element.attachShadow

notes: This is just a wrapper for Element.attachShadow that executes custom framework functionality after the super call.
return: ShadowRoot The ShadowRoot instance created by Element.attachShadow.
name: attachShadow

desc:
A stub for developers to control the Shadow DOM of the component.

By default, this method will simply call MythixUIComponent.attachShadow in "open" mode.

Developers can overload this to do nothing (have no Shadow DOM for a specific component for example), or to do something else, such as specify they would like their component to be in "closed" mode.

The result of this method is assigned to this.shadow inside the constructor of the component.

arguments.name: options
arguments.desc: options for Element.attachShadow

notes: All this does is call this.attachShadow. Its purpose is for the developer to control what happens with the component's Shadow DOM.
return: ShadowRoot The ShadowRoot instance created by MythixUIComponent.attachShadow.
name: createShadowDOM

desc: A self-resetting timeout. This method expects an id argument (or will generate one from the provided callback method if not provided). It uses this provided id to create a timeout. This timeout has a special feature however that differentiates it from a normal setTimeout call: if you call this.debounce again with the same id before the time runs out, then it will automatically reset the timer. In short, only the last call to this.debounce (given the same id) will take effect (unless the specified timeout is reached between calls).
return:
This method returns a specialized Promise instance. The instance is specialized because the following properties are injected into it:

  1. resolve(resultValue) - When called, resolves the promise with the first provided argument
  2. reject(errorValue) - When called, rejects the promise with the first provided argument
  3. status() - When called, will return the fulfillment status of the promise, as a string, one of: "pending", "fulfilled", or "rejected"
  4. id<string> - A randomly generated ID for this promise

See Utils.createResolvable

arguments.name: callback
arguments.desc: The method to call when the timeout has been met.

arguments.name: timeMS
arguments.desc: The number of milliseconds to wait before calling callback.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc:
The identifier for this debounce timer. If not provided, then one
will be generated for you based on the provided callback.

notes: Though not required, it is faster and less problematic to provide your own id argument
name: debounce
MYTHIX_NAME_VALUE_PAIR_HELPER
desc:
This is used as a metadata key by Utils.globalStoreNameValuePairHelper to store key/value pairs for a single value.

Mythix UI has global store and fetch helpers for setting and fetching dynamic properties. These methods only accept a single value by design‚Ä¶ but sometimes it is desired that a value be set with a specific key instead. This MYTHIX_NAME_VALUE_PAIR_HELPER property assists with this process, allowing global helpers to still function with a single value set, while in some cases still passing a key through to the setter. arrow_outward
notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Use at your own risk. This is Mythix UI internal code that might change in the future.

name: MYTHIX_SHADOW_PARENT
desc: This is used as a metadata key by MythixUIComponent to store the parent node of a Shadow DOM, so that it can later be traversed by Utils.getParentNode.
notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Use at your own risk. This is Mythix UI internal code that might change in the future.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.getParentNode.

name: MYTHIX_TYPE
desc: This is used for type checking by instanceof checks to determine if an instance is a specific type (even across javascript contexts and library versions). arrow_outward
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.isType.

name: DYNAMIC_PROPERTY_TYPE
desc: Used for runtime type reflection against Utils.DynamicProperty.
notes: üëÅÔ∏è Utils.DynamicProperty.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.isType.
üëÅÔ∏è Utils.MYTHIX_TYPE.

name: isMythixComponent
desc:
This symbol is used as an instance key for MythixUIComponent instances.

For such instances, accessing this property simply returns true, allowing the caller to know if a specific instance (Element) is a Mythix UI component.

name: MYTHIX_INTERSECTION_OBSERVERS
desc:
This symbol is used as a Utils.metadata key against elements with a data-src attribute. For elements with this attribute, set an intersection observer is setup. When the intersection observer reports that the element is visible, then the URL specified by data-src is fetched, and dumped into the element as its children. This allows for dynamic "partials" that are loaded at run-time.

The value stored at this Utils.metadata key is a Map of intersection observer instances. The keys of this map are the intersection observers themselves. The values are raw objects with the shape { wasVisible: boolean, ratioVisible: float, previousVisibility: boolean, visibility: boolean }.

caption: ‚Ä¶ HTMLElement Instance Properties
desc: All HTMLElement Instance Properties are inherited from HTMLElement

name: isMythixComponent
caption: [static MythixUIComponent.isMythixComponent]
desc: Is true for Mythix UI components.

name: sensitiveTagName
caption: sensitiveTagName
desc: Works identically to Element.tagName for XML, where case is preserved. In HTML this works like Element.tagName, but instead of the result always being UPPERCASE, the tag name will be returned with the casing preserved.

name: templateID
caption: templateID
desc: This is a convenience property that returns the value of this.constructor.TEMPLATE_ID

name: delayTimers
caption: delayTimers
desc: A Map instance that retains setTimeout ids so that MythixUIComponent.debounce can properly function. Keys are MythixUIComponent.debounce timer ids (of type string). Values are Promise instances. Each promise instance also has a special key timerID that contains a setTimeout id of a javascript timer.
notes: ‚ö†Ô∏è Use at your own risk. This is Mythix UI internal code that might change in the future.
dataTypes: Map<string, Promise>

name: shadow
caption: shadow
desc: The shadow root of this component (or null if none).
notes: This is the cached result of calling MythixUIComponent.createShadowDOM when the component is first initialized.

name: template
caption: template
desc: The template element for this component, or null if there is no template found for the component.
notes: This is the cached result of calling MythixUIComponent.getComponentTemplate when the component is first initialized.
